docs.text: " with all that education , you should know what happiness is . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: starring sylvia chang , teresa hu , hsu ming , li lieh , mao hsueh-wei ; directed by edward yang ; written by yang and wu nien-chen ; cinematography by christopher doyle and chang hui-kung
docs.label: negative

docs.text: every country has , eventually , its new wave .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: france had its nouvelle vague , brazil its cinema novo , china its fifth generation , and on and on .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: some waves just take longer than others , before they wash over us , cleansing us with the balm of discovery .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: taiwan's new wave came in the 1980s , in the work of directors like hou hsiao-hsien , wan jen , and edward yang ; that day , on the beach--yang's first feature--is central .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it created a new language for young taiwanese directors , even if the first attempts to speak that language were hesitant and faltering .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: later works refined the techniques that yang first explored here , giving taiwan a distinctive international presence .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that day itself is long and frustrating , the document of a nation's attempt to find a voice .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it does not lack ambition .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it anatomizes urban life in modern taiwan , in the manner of antonioni , elaborating the alienation that the westernized white-collar middle-class feel as their lives are shaped by old-fashioned roles--dedicated career men , loyal housewives--that they find unfulfilling .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jia-li ( sylvia chang ) is the focus , but the film brings others into its compass--her husband , her brother , friends from her college days--as it charts her discontents .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: no one is happy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jia-li married her husband , we-lei , at a young age .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at the time , her brother had been urged into an arranged marriage , despite his affection for another woman , and so jia-li's marriage seemed , in comparison , a good one : she chose we-lei of her own free will , they loved each other .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but it goes wrong .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that day dutifully presents all the clich ? s : we-lei becomes absorbed in his career , indulges in an affair with a co-worker ; jia-li feels restless and trapped , bound by a choice she made while young , but which no longer seems wise .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film never redeems these clich ? s by conveying the feel of authentic experience , the intensity of lived pain , and much of it seems trite and belaboured .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it unfolds , awkwardly , as a series of flashbacks , told during a luncheon in vienna , where jia-li meets her brother's old flame ( teresa hu ) , now a concert pianist , whom she has not seen since college .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: both women seem rather sad , and resigned to their sadness .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: their circumstances ( and those of jia-li's brother and a college friend ) suggest not so much that they have made the wrong choices--married the wrong man , chosen the wrong career path , etc . --but rather that the choices available to them were inadequate .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is not that jia-li married the wrong man ; she didn't .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the problem is that she needed to marry at all--and that if she did not marry , she would still be just as unhappy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for a woman in modern taiwan , that day tells us , the cards are stacked , the dice are loaded : she can play the game , but the house always wins .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film's sympathetic feminist implications are presumably the reason it caused such controversy upon its release in taiwan .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: seen now , it does not seem provocative .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: indeed , it's hard to imagine anyone having felt passionate enough about the film to generate any controversy : it may be ambitious , it may be innovative , but it is also terribly , terribly dull .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and what was new for taiwan was not necessarily new for the rest of us : yang adopts methods established years before by antonioni and others , and his use of those methods is fumbling , uncertain , undisciplined .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: nor does he bring anything new--other than the locale--to the material .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there are moments when that day takes on some of the emotional richness it strives for--in a young couple's first kiss , in the awkward meeting of a woman and her husband's mistress--but they are brief .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: too often , yang devotes needless time to mundane scenes--grocery shopping , flower-arranging--in which nothing happens , little is said , no emotion imparted .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: perhaps , if the film were content to focus on such reflective , inward moments , leaving us to guess at thoughts and feelings , it might have been ambiguous , suggestive , insinuating .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but jia-li and her disaffected companions do not only brood in silence : they talk about their problems , at length , in detail , redundantly , and eliminate all subtleties .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at two hours and forty-five minutes , it all seems exorbitantly long , indulgently long-winded .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: consider the defining moment for jia-li , the titular day on the beach .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the thrust of the whole film explains , easily enough , what we are to think of that moment , what it means when she walks away from a particular situation .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: even so , the film has not one but two characters explain it for us verbally , in case we may have missed the point .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: needless time is devoted to expressing what should have remained unexpressed , and that is the problem throughout .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the look of the film is as tedious as the drawn-out narrative .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it was the first feature shot by christopher doyle--at least , it's his name in the credits--who is now rightly regarded as one of the world's leading cinematographers .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the freewheeling expressionism of his work with directors like chen kaige and wong kar-wai , he seems incapable of fashioning a boring image .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you would never know it from watching that day , which , due either to doyle's inexperience or yang's humdrum direction , is almost perverse in its insistence on making the physical environment seem as drab and banal as possible .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in scrutinizing the long decay of a marriage , that day manages to capture the ennui of the experience , but none of the damage , none of the heartbreak .
docs.label: negative
